doc.title: phylip

description.text: PHYLIP is a package of programs for inferring phylogenies.

doc.reference: Felsenstein, J. 1993. PHYLIP (Phylogeny Inference Package) version 3.5c. Distributed by the author. Department of Genetics, University of Washington, Seattle.
Felsenstein, J. 1989. PHYLIP -- Phylogeny Inference Package (Version 3.2). Cladistics 5: 164-166.

comment.text: MIX is a general parsimony program which carries out the Wagner and Camin-Sokal parsimony methods in mixture, where each character can have its method specified separately. The program defaults to carrying out Wagner parsimony.

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

div.div:
Example data (click on [use example data] to load):
5 6 Alpha 110110 Beta 110000 Gamma 100110 Delta 001001 Epsilon 001110

xhtml:div.label:
Use ancestral states (A)?
Yes No
Give a ancestors file whenever you enable this parameter

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The A (Ancestral states) option. This indicates that we are specifying the ancestral states for each character.
In the menu the ancestors (A) option must be selected. An ancestral states input file is read, whose default name is ancestors.
It contains a line or lines giving the ancestral states for each character. These may be 0, 1 or ?
the latter indicating that the ancestral state is unknown.
An example is: 001??11
The ancestor information can be continued to a new line and can have blanks between any of the characters in the same way that species character data can.

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label:
Parsimony method (P)?
Wagner Camin-Sokal
Only if Use Mixed method is disabled.

Use Mixed method (X)?
Yes No
Give a mixure file whenever you choose Mixed method

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The X (miXture) option. Move, and Penny the user can specify for each character which parsimony method is in effect.
This is done by selecting menu option X (not M) and having an input mixture file . It contains a line or lines with and one letter for each character.
These letters are C or S if the character is to be reconstructed according to Camin-Sokal parsimony, W or ? if the character is to be reconstructed according to Wagner parsimony.
So if there are 20 characters the line giving the mixture might look like this:
WWWCC WWCWC

Note that blanks in the sequence of characters (after the first ones that are as long as the species names) will be ignored, and the information can go on to a new line at any point. So this could equally well have been specified by
WW
CCCWWCWC

fieldset.legend: Randomize and Multiple data set options

xhtml:div.label: I want to choose a method Randomize input order of species Analyze multiple data sets

number of data set?
If you choose Analyze multiple data sets, you must indicate the number of sets you have.

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Random number seed (must be odd)
Number of times to jumble
Compute a consensus tree Yes No

Use User tree (default: search for best tree) (U)?
Yes No
The user-defined trees supplied if you use the U option must be given as rooted trees with two-way splits (bifurcations)

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Give a tree whenever the infile does not already contain the tree.

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label:
How many tree(s) in the User Tree file?
Give this information whenever the infile does not already contain the tree.

Print out tree (3)?
Yes No
Tells the program to print a semi-graphical picture of the tree in the outfile.
Print out steps in each character (4) Yes No
Print states at all nodes of tree (5) Yes No

Write out trees onto tree file (6)?
Yes No
Tells the program to save the tree in a treefile (a standard representation of trees where the tree is specified by a nested pairs of parentheses, enclosing names and separated by commas).
Print out the data at start of run (1) Yes No

paragraph.name: jumble_dataset
paragraph.prompt: Randomize and Multiple data set options

interface.label: I want to choose a method Randomize input order of species Analyze multiple data sets

comment.text: If you choose Analyze multiple data sets, you must indicate the number of sets you have.

message.text: Enter a value > 0 ; there must be no more than 1000 datasets for this server

interface.label:
number of data set?
If you choose Analyze multiple data sets, you must indicate the number of sets you have.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: If you choose Analyze multiple data sets, you must indicate the number of sets you have.

message.text: Random number seed must be odd

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

message.text: the product of "number of times to jumble" and number of data set (if define) must be less than 100000

precond.code: ( jumble_or_dataset is not None ) and ( jumble_or_dataset == "J" )
( jumble_or_dataset is not None ) and ( jumble_or_dataset == "D" )

format.code:
"M
D
" + str( data_nb ) + "
" + str( seed ) +"
" + str( times ) +"
"

"M
D
" + str( data_nb ) + "
" + str( seed ) +"
" + str( times ) +"
"
($value) ? " && cp infile mix.infile && cp mix.outtree intree && consense <consense.params && mv outtree consense.outtree && mv outfile consense.outfile" : ""
("" , " && cp infile mix.infile && cp mix.outtree intree && consense <consense.params && mv outtree consense.outtree && mv outfile consense.outfile")[ value ]
